text:
The problem is in
org.apache.log4j.xml.DOMConfigurator.findAppenderByReference(), the code segment
marked "Endre's hack".  It calls appenderRef.getOwnerDocument() then scans the
whole document for <appender> elements.  If DOMConfigurator.configure() is
invoked with a DOM tree fragment extracted using, in my case,
org.jdom.output.DOMOutputter, then there *is* no owner document, so this hack
fails to find any <appender> elements.

Created attachment 858
This fix works for me, and I think it is also more correct than the hack it replaces.
creator: andrewb@zip.com.au

text:
Andrew thank you for the patch. It is quite reasonable. I do not want to invest 
too much time in fixing the DOMConfigurator while log4j 1.3 will include a much 
more powerful alternative based on completely different code. I am marking this 
bug as FIXED-WONTFIX. Thank you for your understanding.
